name: General Chemistry I
description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of Chemistry. Students will study atomic structure, bonding, stoichiometry, chemical reactions, gases, liquids and solids, thermochemistry, and solutions.

name: General Chemistry II
description: This course builds on the concepts introduced in General Chemistry I, and introduces students to equilibrium, acids and bases, thermodynamics, kinetics, oxidation-reduction reactions, electrochemistry, and nuclear chemistry.

name: Organic Chemistry I
description: This course focuses on the chemistry of carbon compounds. Students will study bonding, nomenclature, isomerism, stereochemistry, reactions of alkanes and cycloalkanes, and the chemical behavior of alkyl halides.

name: Analytical Chemistry
description: This course introduces students to the principles of chemical analysis. Students will study statistical analysis, gravimetric analysis, titrimetry, electrochemistry, chromatography, spectroscopy, and quality control.

name: Environmental Chemistry
description: This course focuses on the chemical aspects of environmental issues. Students will study environmental pollutants, atmospheric chemistry, water quality, waste treatment, and global climate change.

name: Physical Chemistry
description: This course explores the theoretical basis of chemical phenomena. Students will study thermodynamics, quantum chemistry, spectroscopy, kinetics, statistical mechanics, and surface chemistry.

name: Inorganic Chemistry
description: This course examines the chemistry of the elements. Students will study atomic and molecular structure, periodic properties, coordination compounds, organometallic compounds, and bioinorganic chemistry.

name: Biochemistry
description: This course focuses on the chemical basis of life processes. Students will study bioenergetics, protein structure and function, enzyme kinetics, metabolism, and nucleic acid structure and function.
